meanings.definition: To touch or handle clumsily or roughly with the hands
meanings.sent1: The toddler was pawing at the toy, trying to grab it.
meanings.sent2: The cat was pawing at the yarn, making a mess.
meanings.sent3: She was pawing at the door, thinking it was a push instead of a pull.
meanings.sent4: The bear was pawing at the beehive, trying to get honey.
meanings.sent5: The puppy was pawing at the treat bag, eager for a snack.

meanings.definition: To strike or scrape with a paw
meanings.sent1: The lion was pawing at the ground, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent2: The kitten was pawing at the ball of yarn, playing happily.
meanings.sent3: He was pawing at the table, pretending to be a magician.
meanings.sent4: The horse was pawing at the gate, impatient to go outside.
meanings.sent5: The raccoon was pawing at the trash can, looking for food.

meanings.definition: To move or scrape with the feet
meanings.sent1: The dancer was pawing at the floor, creating a rhythm.
meanings.sent2: The dog was pawing at the carpet, trying to dig a hole.
meanings.sent3: She was pawing at the sand, building a castle.
meanings.sent4: The bird was pawing at the branch, searching for insects.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was pawing at the tree trunk, looking for a hiding spot.
